titleStmt.title: K. F. Prichard to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9647

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Louisa Lawrence Co Ky
November 22 1860
Hon B MaGoffin
Governor Kentucky
Dear Sir:
Mr, Neimiah Kitchen Stands convicted at the oct Term 1860 of our Circuit Court for Keeping a Tipling house fined $60
I as Co atty prosecuted Mr Kitchen before a Justice of the Peace & fined him $60 for the same unlawful selling

Mr Kitchen employed an attorny to plead the former conviction in Bar -- but owing to the unskilfullness of his attory the plea did not avail him in the manner in which it was pleaded & Judgment went against him It was agreed by the attony for the Commonwealth that should make this statement to your worship & ask that the fine
be remitted My personal acquaintance with Mr Kitchern is such as enables me to say to you that he is not a violater of the Law generally -- but is the reverse -- a good & loyal Citizen & has never to my Knowledge violated our penal Laws before. These are the facts in the case. If you ^now^ thinks this state of cause demands your clemency please direct the order remiting the fine to me at Louisa, so I can send it immediately to Mr Kitchen who lives in a remote part of the County & who is very anxious to hear from his case

With sentiment of regard
I am your obt Servt
K. F. Prichard
Co atty
